comments.text:
My point of view is that these complex properties are often better edited in UIs that are specific to these properties.

For instance, we recently added a tooltip for editing CSS Filters:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Page_Inspector/How_to/Edit_CSS_filters
And we also have one for cubic-bezier timing-functions:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Page_Inspector/How_to/Work_with_animations#Edit_timing_functions

That's because these properties are complex to type and get right, and often, a guided UI works better, especially when you have real-time preview.

We could add one for CSS transforms too (right now we have a nice on-hover preview of the transform).

Related to this, webkit recently innovated in this direction by providing a new visual style panel: https://twitter.com/webkit/status/634392489579925504
